job_title: Personal Care Attendant in Hamilton, ON
pros: Met some great people- both colleagues and clients.
cons:
Had a colleague who would sleep on the job, putting the clients at risk. Reported her and she was suspended for a couple of days and came back to make my life miserable. Would play religious material, be offensive and rude when I wanted to protect our vulnerable people. 
In the end they kept her and I was released as I was on probation. More to the story but long story short- the homophobic, hateful rhetoric was just not worth it. Horrible agency.

job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Specialist in Midtown Toronto, ON
pros: Working with March of Dimes Canada allowed me to meet and assist very interesting clientele.
cons: Inconsistency from management and team leads with no Human Resources assistance especially when several messages left without return phone calls. When management has biases, not seeing own mistakes which leads to employee fall back, not review or listening to all information from coworkers especially if it involves another member in which they are closely involved with and/or built relationships with. With proof, how can an employee of 19 years be let go with 19 years of great evaluations, workmanship, employee morale, be let go without Human Resources or other employees question that or follow up on? especially when the falt of the person leaves within 2 weeks of the other person being let go.

job_title: Vocational Rehab Consultant in Moncton, NB
pros: Amazing supportive management. Supportive of staff.
cons: Very large company. Hard to connect.

review_title: Lots of calls, opportunity to work
job_title: PSw in Chatham, ON
pros: Good management and understanding staff
cons: Can get calls early when worked late

review_title: Their heart is in the right place, but the rest is broken.
job_title: Support Services Attendant in Halton Hills, ON
pros:
Working with the clients

Feeling you're doing something vitally important, in the community
cons:
Wage hasn't kept up to actual inflation, making most staff, members of the working poor

Short Shifts

Constant split shifts

They never meet the minimum hours for full-time contracts

Neverending calls/emails requesting coverage during off hours, due to being  short handed from high staff turnover

Mindboggling huge wear & tear on personal vehicles, which attendants never get fully compensated for either through pay, or expenses

Serious health & safety issues, that never get addressed due to high turnover of team leaders (CSL's), or office staff

job_title: Program Assistant in Toronto, ON
pros: Decent benefits package for permanent employees.  Working for a really good cause.  Co-workers are generally nice people.  Large workloads and not enough human resources to provide support.
cons: Everyone starts at 2 weeks vacation, unless it's for a manager position or higher.  Salaries are quite low compared to the same position in larger non-for-profits.  The bureaucracy for getting anything done is stifling - especially for finance.  It can be hard to make friends in different departments - very cliquey.

review_title: Was going to be my long term Career, Until Management decided to hire a relative.
job_title: Service Delivery Worker in Chatham, ON
pros: Benefits are good, most of the atmosphere with colleagues was very good, Pay was adequate, hours were awesome!
cons: Management plays favorites, expects lower salaried employees to carry the brunt of the senior employees work, does not have respect for or willingness to work with, long term employees who become disabled to enable them to continue working, Some reporting practices on Employees final payroll are corrupt and fraudulent. if they leave without management blessing. Turnover is disproportionate excessive  in comparison to actual amount of staff on payroll.

review_title: Great experience! Worked in a number of different roles within the organization and learned a lot!
job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Specialist in Sudbury, ON
pros: Great management and leadership, friendly and warm environment, staff who genuinely care about the organization's cause, opportunities for advancement especially if you're willing to put in the time and also move locations, Great work life balance, flex schedule available which gives every second Friday off. Organization is a big believer of Fish Philosophy. Excellent salary and compensation which reflects education and designations obtained.
cons: Very few if any... employee review is only done once a year (probably due to the fact that they are non profit and therefore more limited time and resources), but not really a big deal as supervisors and managers are always willing to make time to speak with you if you have any issues or concerns.

job_title: Employment Support Worker in Kingston, ON
pros: Decent benefits, convenient location, generally nice clients, easy work, not high-pressure, satisfaction of helping others, excellent work-life balance. They gave us all the holidays and they made an effort to have team-building activities and outings now and then. The Christmas parties were especially nice.
cons: Low pay, (some) difficult, inflexible management, boredom (x3), routine work, clients presenting mental illness, domestic issues and other challenges outside of the jurisdiction of employment services.

review_title: Strong organization overall that offers important services
job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Specialist
pros:
Very supportive environment with a management team that actively responds to employee concerns. 

Well remunerated in the position that I hold when compared to comparable to other non-profit agencies hiring for the same role

It can be personally rewarding serving clients.
cons:
Persistent IT issues (network lags and computers that are not always able to handle the software packages that are required to run as part of the job); this is improving, however. 

It is a large organization that offers many different services, which has its own pros and cons...

job_title: Vocational Rehabilitation Counselor  in Kitchener, ON
pros: March of Dimes is a good place to work.  The team is hard working and management is supportive.  There are also opportunities for personal and professional growth.
cons: The main downside is the workload.   Employees are expected to work hard.  The workload is very heavy and deadlines are tight.  The work is also very fast paced.  Employees have to work overtime often with no extra pay in order to complete work.

review_title: Cared about consumers but not about staff
job_title: Community Support Supervisor in Toronto, ON
pros: MODC truly cares about the consumers it serves and the incredible service it’s staff delivers.
cons: Senior management are protected regardless of how terribly the treat middle management and frontline staff.

review_title: Not the best place to work
job_title: S S A in St. Catharines, ON
pros: You get paid for a whole shift (7-3,3-11,11-7,8-12,5-9) instead of individual clients scattered throughout the day. Even if the client is in hospital for weeks.
cons:
You are on call, so you have to fit extra work into an already too full schedule. It can get hectic, especially when road conditions are poor, or you have to get to an area under construction.
Always were given a hard time when calling in sick.

review_title: Good for first time job seeker, not many opportunities for career development.
job_title: Supervisor in Toronto, ON
pros: Good vision. In the first few weeks, human resourse department will get new employees to attend several workshops to get them adapt quickly to the organization.
cons: Not enough parking spots. Tons of paper work, need approved form for every work you want to do, which slow down the efficiency.

review_title: A good mission, but not so good in practice
job_title: SSA in Niagara Falls, ON
pros: A good mission statement and good values, along with hard working and supportive front line staff. Most managers tried and did what they could to help out/be supportive.
cons: Always short staffed. I was part time staff but often got guilted into full time hours from management. Lack of proper training/preparation of staff, and performance protocols. Staff asked/expected to perform support activities beyond mentioned in job description. Client files were often incomplete or vague, missing vital/essential information for client and staff safety. As many others, I left after a few months of employment for my own well-being and safety.

job_title: Employer & Client Coordinator in Toronto, ON
pros: Supportive atmosphere; outstanding health benefits; great supervisors; great problem solving
cons: Contract work depending on WSIB, CanVet and Community Coordinator Project funding for the Vocational Rehabilitation departments.  Really strict with their requirements for hiring for these positions as well.  Looks at university education instead of experience and overall skill set; needs more staff for the smaller offices; can quickly find yourself overworked (working from home to catch up)

job_title: Team Leader in Toronto, ON
pros: training, team spirit, community involvement, making a difference, gives back to community, good communication, inclusive group, makes a difference, well known, loyal employees
cons: lower salary then other companies. Due to low turn-over, advancement is challenging to accomplish. I am not sure what else to add.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Hamilton, ON
pros: Clients are the best, they are so inspiring and motivational.  The actual work is so fulfilling. The hours are flexible.
cons: Policies are ridiculous, responsibility for budgeting is non existent.  Management is poor and has free reign over staff with no written backup.

review_title: Great loved the company and the consumers
